messageBody:
Devda,

Sorry for the late reply. You're right--JUnit adds all the tests to a
suite, and then executes them. Can you give more details why you'd like to
avoid this? Is adding tests to your suite expensive? Thanks,

David Saff

On 4/6/07, Devda Ghanshyamsinh <grdevda@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> I am in the process of testing my TestCases and TestSuites Sequentially.
>
> But when I run a TestSuite composing TestCases and TestSuites, (the
> suite method)it add all the tests and then this test are executed.
>
> How can I change this behaviour, if I want to run the test inside
> "suite" method, as soon as they are added in a TestSuite.
>
> Eg:
> --------------------------------
> TS1
> ----TC1 (want to run the test as soon as they are added)
> ----TS1.1 (want to run the test as soon as they are added)
> ----TC2 (want to run the test as soon as they are added)
